results.title: Circadian variation of the total ischemic burden and influence by beta-blocking agents.
results.text_hl: However, on treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, there was a significant reduction in the frequency and total duration of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ episodes throughout the day.

results.title: Effects of atenolol alone, nifedipine alone and their combination on ambulant myocardial ischemia.
results.text_hl: There were no differences in reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ parameters when @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was compared with @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ (difference not significant).

results.title: Complementary mechanisms of atenolol and diltiazem in the clinical improvement of patients with stable angina.
results.text_hl: Double product at @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ threshold decreased from 20.9 to 19.8 (p = NS) with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ but increased from 20.1 to 21.9 (p = NS) with @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@.

results.title: Anti-ischemic effects of atenolol versus nifedipine in patients with coronary artery disease and ambulatory silent ischemia.
results.text_hl: Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ were effective (p less than 0.005) in reducing the average number and duration of transient @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ events, but therapy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was associated with a significantly greater reduction in the mean number (p less than 0.05) and duration (p less than 0.01) of silent @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ events.

citations.NLM: Deedwania PC, Carbajal EV, Nelson JR, Hait H. Anti-ischemic effects of atenolol versus nifedipine in patients with coronary artery disease and ambulatory silent ischemia. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1991 Mar 15;17(4):963-9. PMID: 1999634
citations.BibTeX: @article{1999634, title={Anti-ischemic effects of atenolol versus nifedipine in patients with coronary artery disease and ambulatory silent ischemia.}, author={Deedwania PC and Carbajal EV and Nelson JR and Hait H}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={963-9}}

results.title: Effect of amlodipine, atenolol and their combination on myocardial ischemia during treadmill exercise and ambulatory monitoring. Canadian Amlodipine/Atenolol in Silent Ischemia Study (CASIS) Investigators.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ and the combination prolonged exercise time to 0.1-mV @DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST segment depression@@@ by 29% and 34%, respectively (p < 0.001) versus 3% for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (p = NS). During ambulatory monitoring, the frequency of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ episodes decreased by 28% with @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (p = 0.083 [NS]), by 57% with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (p < 0.001) and by 72% with the combination (p < 0.05 vs. both single drugs; p < 0.001 vs. placebo).

citations.NLM: Davies RF, Habibi H, Klinke WP, Dessain P, Nadeau C, Phaneuf DC, Lepage S, Raman S, Herbert M, Foris K. Effect of amlodipine, atenolol and their combination on myocardial ischemia during treadmill exercise and ambulatory monitoring. Canadian Amlodipine/Atenolol in Silent Ischemia Study (CASIS) Investigators. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1995 Mar 1;25(3):619-25. PMID: 7860905
